title: Sensitive data exposure via product review API — user emails leaked in responses
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The product review API endpoint returns the email addresses of users who posted reviews. This information is exposed to any user (including unauthenticated users) who views product details.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. No authentication is required
2. Send the following request to get reviews for a product:
```
GET http://localhost:3333/rest/products/1/reviews
```
3. The response contains review objects with full author email addresses:
```json
[
  {
    "message": "One of my all-time favourites!",
    "author": "admin@juice-sh.op",
    "product": 1,
    "likesCount": 0
  }
]
```
4. Repeat for other product IDs (1-37) to enumerate user email addresses
5. This exposes email addresses including admin accounts

## Impact
Medium — User email addresses are exposed without authentication. This enables:
- User enumeration for targeted attacks
- Identification of admin accounts (admin@juice-sh.op)
- Phishing campaigns using legitimate email addresses
- Credential stuffing attacks using harvested emails

## Expected Behavior
Product reviews should either anonymize the author field or use a display name instead of the raw email address.

## Actual Behavior
Full email addresses of review authors are returned in the API response without any anonymization.
